segments.text: I notice the water spilling over the sink, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn’t even flinch, which is kind of amazing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are sneaking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and it looks like it’s about to go over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone seems, even though there’s water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, like this happens all the time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing feels like a comedy of errors, but no one’s laughing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone will notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
